block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM

Great Neck Furman Film Series: ''Sweet Mud,'' directed by Dror Shaul; in Hebrew and French with English subtitles. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $15. Clearview Squire Cinema, 115 Middle Neck Road. (516) 829-2570.

Northport ''All the President's Men,'' directed by Alan J. Pakula; followed by discussion. Thursday at 6 p.m. Free. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Northport Public Library, 151 Laurel Avenue. (631) 261-6930.
FOR CHILDREN
Bridgehampton Beach scavenger hunt, for children and adults. June 9 at 10 a.m. $7; children, $5. South Fork Natural History Museum, 377 Bridgehampton/Sag Harbor Turnpike. (631) 537-9735.
Cold Spring Harbor ''Herp Day,'' exhibits presented by the Long Island Herpetological Society. June 3, noon to 5 p.m. Cold Spring Harbor Fish Hatchery and Aquarium, 1660 Route 25A. (516) 692-6768.

Kings Park ''Buzzing About Bees.'' Learn how bees make honey and feed their young, followed by walk. Ages 5 and up. June 9 at 2 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Nissequogue River State Park, St. Johnland Road. (631) 269-4927.
Long Beach Baywalk; see plants and animals that live in the bay. $3. June 9 at 10:30 a.m. Theodore Roosevelt Nature Center, Ocean Parkway. (516) 679-7254.
Port Jefferson ''Billy Goat Gruff,'' children's theater. Through June 11. $8. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Port Washington Port Washington's 17th Annual Harborfest; crafts, children's activities, model boat regatta and food. June 3, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Town Dock and Lower Main Street, (516) 883-6566.
Riverhead ''Ancient Eggs,'' exhibition of fossilized dinosaur eggs. Through Sept. 3. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.
Riverhead ''Magnets.'' Learn about magnets and make a magnet craft. June 3, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. $2; children, $5. Long Island Science Center, 11 West Main Street. (631) 208-8000.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Blue Point ''Lions Via Lyricism,'' presented by Anne Taffel, piano; works by Beethoven, Chopin and others. Sunday at 2 p.m. Free. Bayport-Blue Point Public Library, 203 Blue Point Avenue. (631) 363-6133.
Farmingdale Enuff Z'nuff, Britny Fox and David Show perform rock and roll. Wednesday at 7 p.m. $13; in advance, $10. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.

Great River New York's Most Dangerous Big Band. Sunday at 2 p.m. Free. Miller's Crossing bluegrass band. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Bayard Cutting Arboretum State Park, 440 Montauk Highway. (631) 224-5420.
Hempstead Lainie Kazan in concert. June 9 and 10. $28; $25, seniors; $15 students. John Cranford Adams Playhouse, Hofstra University, South Campus. (516) 463-6644.
Huntington Vladimir Zaitsev, pianist. Sunday at 3 p.m. Free. Huntington Public Library, 338 Main Street. (631) 427-5165.
Huntington Joan Armatrading. Friday at 7 and 10 p.m. $45; $34, members. Inter-Media Art Center, 370 New York Avenue. (631) 549-2787.
Long Beach ''Visual Music,'' digital graphics created and accompanied by Michael A. Luckman, piano. Friday at 2 p.m. Free. Long Beach Public Library, 111 West Park Avenue. (516) 432-7201.

Port Washington ''La Vie en Rose,'' presented by Doreen Dixson Gamell; works by Poulenc, Weill and others. June 9 at 8 p.m. $15; seniors, $10. Jeanne Rimsky Theater at the Landmark on Main Street, 232 Main Street. (516) 767-6444.
Smithtown Traditional New England Barn Dance Workshop. Friday at 7:45 p.m. $14; members, $10; students, $7. Smithtown Historical Society, 211 Main Street. (631) 369-7854.
Southampton The Peconic Youth Orchestra. June 10 at 3 p.m. Free. Southampton Cultural Center, 25 Pond Lane. (631) 287-4377.
OUTDOORS
East Norwich Smell the Roses, nature walk to view a variety of roses. Sunday at 10 a.m. $3; reservations required. Muttontown Preserve, Muttontown Lane. (516) 571-8500.

Garden City ''AirPlay.'' Take part in an air race and navigate air mazes. Through Sept. 2, Tuesday through Friday, at 10 a.m. $9; $8 seniors. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Huntington Salt Marsh Special, adult nature hike along five-mile trail. Sunday at 9:30 a.m. $3; reservations required. Literary Walk (Western Section), adult leisurely walk with readings from nature writings. June 10 at 11 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.
Kings Park Botany: From Beach to the Forest, adult nature hike. Sunday at 2 p.m. $3; reservations required. Nissequogue River State Park, St. Johnland Road. (631) 269-4927.
Oakdale Adult Night Hike. June 9 at 8 p.m. $3; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.
SPOKEN WORD

Glen Cove Christos Nicola, author of ''The Secret of Priest's Grotto,'' discussion and slides. Sunday at 1:30 p.m. Free; refreshments provided. Holocaust Memorial and Tolerance Center, 100 Crescent Beach Road. (516) 571-8040.

Huntington Michael Kresh, author of ''You Can Afford to Retire.'' Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Mike Lupica, author of ''Summer Ball.'' June 9 at 7 p.m. Free. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.

Northport Northport Historical Society's Speaker Series: The historians Joan O'Sullivan Lengyel and Orlando Lopes talk about neighborhood theaters. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. Northport Historical Society Museum, 215 Main Street. (631) 757-9859.

West Hills ''Walt Whitman Birthday Celebration,'' readings by poet David Wagoner. Sunday at noon. $5 per family. Marathon reading of Whitman's ''Song of Myself.'' Call (631) 427-5240 to sign up to read your favorite part. June 10 at 2 p.m. Walt Whitman Birthplace State Historic Site and Interpretive Center, 246 Old Walt Whitman Road. (631) 427-5240.
THEATER
Bellport ''Cold as Ice,'' on-ice musical by Frank D'Agostino, performed by Oksana Baiul and other skaters. Through June 17. $39 to $43. Gateway Playhouse, 215 South Country Road. (631) 286-1133.
Commack ''42nd Street,'' musical by Michael Stewart, Mark Bramble, Al Dubin and Harry Warren. Through June 3. $14 to $21. Suffolk Y Jewish Community Center, 74 Hauppauge Road. (631) 462-9800.

East Farmingdale ''Blood Moon,'' by Nicholas Kazan. Through June 3. $18 and $22. Neil Simon's ''Oscar and Felix,'' presented by the Arena Players Repertory Theater. Through June 10. $18 and $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
Elmont ''My Fair Lady,'' musical by Lerner and Loewe. Through June 23. $14 to $28. BroadHollow Theater, 700 Hempstead Turnpike. (631) 581-2700.
Lindenhurst ''Sideman'' by Warren Leight, presented by BroadHollow Theater Company. Through June 24. $14 to $22. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.

North Merrick ''A Thurber Carnival,'' directed by Kathy Becker, presented by Lantern Theater. Through June 10, Saturdays and Sundays only. $15; $13, seniors. Brookside School, 1260 North Meadowbrook Road. (516) 221-4485.
Oakdale ''The Full Monty'' by Terrence McNally and David Yazbek. Through June 3. $20; seniors, $18; students, $16. CM Performing Arts Center, 931 Montauk Highway. (631) 218-2810.
Port Jefferson Bob Fosse's ''Sweet Charity.'' Through June 20. $20 to $28. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Quogue ''Léocadia,'' by Jean Anouilh, presented by Hampton Theater Company. Through June 17. $20; seniors, $18; students, $10. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
Sag Harbor ''Things Being What They Are'' by Wendy MacLeod, directed by Leonard Foglia. Through June 3. $50 to $65. Bay Street Theater, Main and Bay Streets. (631) 725-9500.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Bellport ''Contrast and Harmony,'' work by LuAnn Thompson and Chris Taylor. Through June 30. Wednesday through Saturday, at 11 a.m. Free. Phoenix Fine Art Gallery, 139 South Country Road.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $4; seniors and students, $3; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.

East Hampton Drawings by Linda Etcoff and Clifford Ross. Friday through July 9. Free. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Drawing Room, 16R Newtown Lane. (631) 324-5016.

East Islip ''Surface Impressions,'' works by artists exploring the idea of surface in canvas, sculpture and mixed media. Through Sunday. Donation: $3. ''Site Specifics '07,'' an exhibition of installations and mixed-media work. June 9 through July 29. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Greenport ''Dark/Stones/Standing,'' photography and photogravure by Barbara Yoshida and metal folk sculpture by Fritz Cass. Through July 5. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m. Sirens' Song Gallery, 516 Main Street. (631) 477-1021.

Huntington ''Vaux,'' works by Richard, Sandra and Joe Vaux. Thursday through July 7. Reception: June 9 at 5 p.m. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''A Time for Reflection,'' photographs by Seth Kalmowitz. Through July 1. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Melville ''Fresh Air,'' works by Sanford Forrester, Barbara Gruber, Donald Thiergard and M. Ellen Winter. Through Monday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Art-trium, 25 Melville Park Road. (631) 271-8423.
Patchogue Live in the Lobby: Janira and Giovanni Von Essen perform adult contemporary music. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $10. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.

Riverhead ''Duality,'' an all media art show. Friday through July 13. Reception: Friday at 5 p.m. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. East End Arts Council Gallery, 133 East Main Street. (631) 727-0900.

Rockville Centre ''Irrevocable,'' works by graduating senior art students. Through June 30. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Molloy College Art Gallery, 1000 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 678-5000.

Rockville Centre Pen and pencil drawings of Victorian architecture by Erin McCauley. Through Sunday. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Phillips House, 28 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 764-7459.

Roslyn Harbor ''Dreams on Canvas: Surrealism in Europe and America.'' Through Aug. 12. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. ''Art to Touch,'' three-dimensional glass reproductions of works by Matisse, Marin and others. Through Aug. 12. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. ''The Music of Regret and Other Works,'' photographs by Laurie Simmons. Through Aug. 12. $10; seniors, $8; children, $4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

East Norwich Smell the Roses, nature walk to view a variety of roses. Sunday at 10 a.m. $3; reservations required. Muttontown Preserve, Muttontown Lane. (516) 571-8500.

Garden City ''AirPlay.'' Take part in an air race and navigate air mazes. Through Sept. 2, Tuesday through Friday, at 10 a.m. $9; $8 seniors. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Huntington Salt Marsh Special, adult nature hike along five-mile trail. Sunday at 9:30 a.m. $3; reservations required. Literary Walk (Western Section), adult leisurely walk with readings from nature writings. June 10 at 11 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.

Oakdale Adult Night Hike. June 9 at 8 p.m. $3; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.
SPOKEN WORD

Glen Cove Christos Nicola, author of ''The Secret of Priest's Grotto,'' discussion and slides. Sunday at 1:30 p.m. Free; refreshments provided. Holocaust Memorial and Tolerance Center, 100 Crescent Beach Road. (516) 571-8040.

Huntington Michael Kresh, author of ''You Can Afford to Retire.'' Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Mike Lupica, author of ''Summer Ball.'' June 9 at 7 p.m. Free. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.

Northport Northport Historical Society's Speaker Series: The historians Joan O'Sullivan Lengyel and Orlando Lopes talk about neighborhood theaters. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. Northport Historical Society Museum, 215 Main Street. (631) 757-9859.

West Hills ''Walt Whitman Birthday Celebration,'' readings by poet David Wagoner. Sunday at noon. $5 per family. Marathon reading of Whitman's ''Song of Myself.'' Call (631) 427-5240 to sign up to read your favorite part. June 10 at 2 p.m. Walt Whitman Birthplace State Historic Site and Interpretive Center, 246 Old Walt Whitman Road. (631) 427-5240.
THEATER
Bellport ''Cold as Ice,'' on-ice musical by Frank D'Agostino, performed by Oksana Baiul and other skaters. Through June 17. $39 to $43. Gateway Playhouse, 215 South Country Road. (631) 286-1133.
Commack ''42nd Street,'' musical by Michael Stewart, Mark Bramble, Al Dubin and Harry Warren. Through June 3. $14 to $21. Suffolk Y Jewish Community Center, 74 Hauppauge Road. (631) 462-9800.

East Farmingdale ''Blood Moon,'' by Nicholas Kazan. Through June 3. $18 and $22. Neil Simon's ''Oscar and Felix,'' presented by the Arena Players Repertory Theater. Through June 10. $18 and $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
Elmont ''My Fair Lady,'' musical by Lerner and Loewe. Through June 23. $14 to $28. BroadHollow Theater, 700 Hempstead Turnpike. (631) 581-2700.
Lindenhurst ''Sideman'' by Warren Leight, presented by BroadHollow Theater Company. Through June 24. $14 to $22. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.

North Merrick ''A Thurber Carnival,'' directed by Kathy Becker, presented by Lantern Theater. Through June 10, Saturdays and Sundays only. $15; $13, seniors. Brookside School, 1260 North Meadowbrook Road. (516) 221-4485.

Port Jefferson Bob Fosse's ''Sweet Charity.'' Through June 20. $20 to $28. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Quogue ''Léocadia,'' by Jean Anouilh, presented by Hampton Theater Company. Through June 17. $20; seniors, $18; students, $10. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
Sag Harbor ''Things Being What They Are'' by Wendy MacLeod, directed by Leonard Foglia. Through June 3. $50 to $65. Bay Street Theater, Main and Bay Streets. (631) 725-9500.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Bellport ''Contrast and Harmony,'' work by LuAnn Thompson and Chris Taylor. Through June 30. Wednesday through Saturday, at 11 a.m. Free. Phoenix Fine Art Gallery, 139 South Country Road.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $4; seniors and students, $3; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.

East Hampton Drawings by Linda Etcoff and Clifford Ross. Friday through July 9. Free. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Drawing Room, 16R Newtown Lane. (631) 324-5016.

East Islip ''Surface Impressions,'' works by artists exploring the idea of surface in canvas, sculpture and mixed media. Through Sunday. Donation: $3. ''Site Specifics '07,'' an exhibition of installations and mixed-media work. June 9 through July 29. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Greenport ''Dark/Stones/Standing,'' photography and photogravure by Barbara Yoshida and metal folk sculpture by Fritz Cass. Through July 5. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m. Sirens' Song Gallery, 516 Main Street. (631) 477-1021.

Huntington ''Vaux,'' works by Richard, Sandra and Joe Vaux. Thursday through July 7. Reception: June 9 at 5 p.m. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''A Time for Reflection,'' photographs by Seth Kalmowitz. Through July 1. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Melville ''Fresh Air,'' works by Sanford Forrester, Barbara Gruber, Donald Thiergard and M. Ellen Winter. Through Monday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Art-trium, 25 Melville Park Road. (631) 271-8423.
Patchogue Live in the Lobby: Janira and Giovanni Von Essen perform adult contemporary music. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $10. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.

Riverhead ''Duality,'' an all media art show. Friday through July 13. Reception: Friday at 5 p.m. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. East End Arts Council Gallery, 133 East Main Street. (631) 727-0900.

Rockville Centre ''Irrevocable,'' works by graduating senior art students. Through June 30. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Molloy College Art Gallery, 1000 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 678-5000.

Rockville Centre Pen and pencil drawings of Victorian architecture by Erin McCauley. Through Sunday. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Phillips House, 28 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 764-7459.

Roslyn Harbor ''Dreams on Canvas: Surrealism in Europe and America.'' Through Aug. 12. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. ''Art to Touch,'' three-dimensional glass reproductions of works by Matisse, Marin and others. Through Aug. 12. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. ''The Music of Regret and Other Works,'' photographs by Laurie Simmons. Through Aug. 12. $10; seniors, $8; children, $4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.
